headline: Ⓥ President & CTO | Technology & Motorsports
summary: Jason is a compassionate leader who has decades of experience building and leading teams. After 20 years in corporate IT, achieving global, executive leadership roles he found himself in a toxic corporate environment. Jason decided working independently in an entrepreneurial manner would be key to future success. Today Jason leads two businesses - AutoInterests, LLC and AI Services, LLC. These combine his passion for both motorsports and technology. AutoInterests is a leading high performance driving school business operating approx. 35 events seasonally in the Midwest US, and is the 3rd largest company in the industry. (https://autointerests.com) AI Services provides a variety of technology services. The Trackside Motorsports Operating System provides everything a race track needs to efficiently operate its ticketing and back-office operations. (https://tracksideapp.com) AI Services also provides fractional CIO, IT consultancy, private cloud hosting and network infrastructure services both in motorsports and a variety of other industries. (https://aiservices.llc) Jason's leadership style builds trust among teams to enable high performance, transparency and camaraderie. His approach builds an unparalled level of collboration where a fail-fast, fail-forward approach allows mistakes to be made with minimal risk and fast rebound, always delivering progress. He believes in a no-nonsense approach where politics and toxic behaviors are quickly squashed and not tolerated. Jason loves to explore new technologies and entrepreneurial ventures. If you have a project you'd like to discuss feel free to send a DM!

experience.position_title: CIO, IT Director, Global Infrastructure Manager, Network Administrator
experience.description: During this 21 year period Jason led 5 different IT organizations as an internal hire, restructuring or building each from the ground up, with budgets exceeding $10M. Leadership roles have included 2X CIO, CTO, National IT Director, Global Infrastructure Manager and General Manager of an IT Consulting firm. Prior to management, Jason was a hands-on Systems Administrator, Network Administrator and technical consultant. Jason's experiences are at an enterprise level with global reach including a 62 hospital healthcare system, IT consulting firm, international aerospace & defense manufacturer, national food manufacturing company, global distribution company, datacenter/consulting startup, web hosting company, SaaS software company and independent IT consultant. Jason has worked in a broad array of industries implementing countless systems, applications and projects at a global scale including Warehouse Management Systems, ERP Systems, Health Information Management Systems, Data Warehouses, Master Data Management, Business Intelligence Solutions, Artificial Intelligence, PDM/PLM, SCADA, PLC Integrations, Manufacturing Execution Systems, HR Information Systems, Datacenter Infrastructure, IT Service Management Tools, CRM/Sales Management, Custom Application Development, Middleware and countless more. This includes managing compliance across numerous major frameworks (NIST, ITAR, EAR, PCI, HIPAA, SOX, SQF and others). This wide-ranging experience equipped Jason with a well-rounded perspective of both business and technology. Jason now works as an entrepreneur and independent consultant. In addition to building and scaling a motporsports SaaS product, he advises corporate clients on IT organization structure, strategy and technical architecture. Corporate clients include publicly traded and privately held global manufacturers, distributors, industrial, medical practices, service organizations and more. Show less

recommendations.recommendation:
“I had the pleasure of working with Jason on a large project, preparing a 380,000 sq ft warehouse and office for occupancy.  As an IT professional, Jason consistently impressed me with his analytical and technical skills and expertise.  He takes a holistic view of a project and finds innovative solutions to complex technical problems. He demonstrates a strong ability to work well under pressure and handle multiple projects.  

Jason has the unique ability to effectively communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders, making him a valuable asset to any team. Thanks to Jason's expertise, the IT portion of the project was completed on time and within budget.  I highly recommend Jason if your organization is in need of IT assistance.”

“Jason is incredibly skilled at building functional teams and leading a department. I worked on Jason's team and we were consistently able to achieve our goals with his support and guidance. Jason sets the bar very high on how an IT department should run and function. He also has a very unique ability to find the right fit, both culture and skills, to add to the team at the right time. I hope to get the chance to work with him again in the future. ”

headline: CTO @enric | Open source AI expert | Ludwig AI and LoRax AI contributor | Speaker | AI as a Service
summary: 🚀 The Startup Sage with a Mindful Edge 🧘 Let me take you on a journey - one that weaves together the grit of entrepreneurship and the profound wisdom of ancient practices. With over 15 years of navigating the intense startup world, I've been through it all: well-funded ventures, bootstrapped survival modes, and even the thrill of acquisition. It's been a rollercoaster ride, but one that has forged me into a seasoned leader with an unwavering resilience and a keen eye for startup success. Yet, my path hasn't been solely about chasing the next big thing. In parallel, I've embarked on a deep exploration of meditation, breathwork, and mindfulness. These ancient techniques have helped me overcome immense personal challenges and unlock incredible self-transformation. It's this unique blend of hard-earned startup grit and profound inner awareness that sets me apart. So, what can I offer you? A rare combination of technical prowess (I'm as comfortable diving into Python code as I am pitching to investors) and a compassionate, mindful approach to business. I'm here to help you build companies that are not only technologically innovative but also socially and environmentally conscious. Together, we'll strike that delicate balance between growth and technical debt, while infusing our ventures with a sense of purpose and meaning. I've worked alongside visionary entrepreneurs, pitched to discerning investors, and built cultures of excellence. But above all, I've learned the art of making tough calls and finding the sweet spot between ambition and mindfulness. Let's join forces and create businesses that truly make a difference – powered by cutting-edge technology and an unwavering commitment to compassion. Are you ready to embark on this transformative journey? Let's blend startup hustle with mindful mastery and change the world, one conscious business at a time. 🌍✨

publications.title: GPU Acceleration of  Equation of State Calculations in Compositional Reservoir Simulation
publications.description: Equation-of-state (EOS) based compositional simulations accurately capture the dynamics of reservoirs with strong compositional effects. One of the major computational bottlenecks in such simulations is the need to enforce the phase equilibrium constraint for the hydrocarbon system for every grid block in the model. These constraints must be enforced at every time step and possibly, at every nonlinear iteration level within each time step for implicit methods. Hence, detailed simulations of models with many millions of cells and a large number of hydrocarbon components are prohibitively time-consuming. However, the high computational intensity and parallelism exhibited by these calculations make them ideal for significant acceleration using high throughput devices such as Graphics Processing Units (GPUs). In this study, we propose new techniques for accelerating the EOS-based phase equilibrium calculations on the GPUs. First, we make full use of the large number of fast registers and floating point units available on GPUs for the double-precision arithmetic , thereby significantly accelerating the equilibrium calculations. Second, we exploit the fast hardware intrinsics available for single precision to further increase the performance. By iteratively combining the single and double-precision calculations, we not only achieve the full accuracy of double-precision but also gain an order-of-magnitude speedup over using double-precision arithmetic alone. Accuracy and performance results from several benchmark problems available in the literature will be provided to demonstrate the speedup achieved using our proposed techniques. The performance results will then be compared with the recently published timings generated using highly optimized code on the CPUs. We will discuss the implications of such performance gains on the selection of implicit algorithms for the full compositional flow simulation. Show less

publications.title: Accelerating Tight Reservoir Workflows With GPUs
publications.description: There are numerous complex characteristics that impact the behavior of wells in tight oil and gas reservoirs. Numerical simulation with fine spatial discretization is required to capture important characteristics such as: the presence of natural fractures; changes in total fluid mobility and compressibility; heterogeneous matrix and fracture properties; and nonuniform stimulation during hydraulic fracturing. This discretization requirement, when combined with the need to include multiple wells to capture interference effects, can result in model sizes in the tens of millions of cells. While these model sizes can sometimes be addressed with current-generation simulators, the excessive run time limits the ability to simulate multiple realizations. We present efforts to eliminate this tradeoff by building a fully-implicit black-oil simulator that combines recent advances in simulation algorithms with the high performance of GPUs. All major computational tasks are executed on GPU, including property evaluation, Jacobian construction, and linear solution with CPR-AMG. This approach allows models with many millions of cells to be simulated within minutes on a single workstation with multiple GPUs. For example, on a tiled SPE 10 model with 55 million cells and 250 wells, we simulate 2000 days of production in 20 minutes using eight GPUs. We summarize our approach to address the challenges in building a fine-grained, scalable simulator. We discuss two challenges in particular: the need to expose massive parallelism while retaining the robustness of linear solvers; and managing the complexity of the many features required by engineers. We discuss how we apply this fully-accelerated technology to increase fidelity and throughput on tight reservoir workflows, improving our understanding of the complex nature of production decline and possible long-term well interference. Furthermore, we illustrate workflows for simulations based on detailed reservoir/fracture descriptions. Show less

publications.title: Realizing the Potential of GPUs for Reservoir Simulation
publications.description: Higher stakes from deep-ocean drilling, increasing complexity from unconventional reservoirs, and an overarching desire for a higher-fidelity subsurface description have led to a demand for reservoir simulators capable of modelling many millions of cells in minutes. Recent advances in heterogeneous computing hardware offer the promise of faster simulation times, particularly through the use of GPUs. Thus far, efforts to take advantage of hardware accelerators have been primarily focused on linear solvers and, in particular, simple preconditioners which often sacrifice rapid convergence for the sake of easy parallelism. This relatively weak convergence, the remaining unaccelerated code paths, and communication bottlenecks have prevented dramatic reductions in run time. A comprehensive approach, however, built from the ground up for accelerators, can deliver on the hardware’s promise to meet industry demand for fast, scalable reservoir simulation. We present the results of our efforts to fully accelerate reservoir simulations on multiple GPUs in an extended black-oil formulation discretized using a fully-implicit finite volume method. We implement all major computational aspects, including property evaluation, Jacobian construction, and robust solvers/preconditioners on GPUs. The CPR-AMG preconditioner we employ allows low iteration count and near-optimal order(N) scaling of computational effort with system size. This combination of algorithms and hardware enables the simulation of fine-scale models with many millions of cells in minutes on a single workstation without any upscaling of the original problem. We discuss the algorithms and methods we employ, give performance and accuracy results on a range of benchmark problems and real assets, and discuss the strong and weak scaling behavior of performance with model size and GPU count. This work was supported by the Marathon Oil Corporation. Show less

experience.description: Optimization of GPU memory hierarchy with nonvolatile memory • GPU has different memory hierarchy compared with CPU in order to efficiently process heavily parallel threads, like a huge register file and TLB. Following the increase in the size and parallelism of threads, the up-scaling capacity is greatly constrained by the SRAM implementation. We propose a novel register file design based on the emerging multi-level cell (MLC) spin-transfer torque RAM (STT-RAM) technology to provide greater capacity and lower energy. By exploiting the asymmetric performance of MLC STT-RAM, a bank-address-remapping strategy and a warp-rescheduling scheme are developed to overcome the performance slowdown introduced by longer STT-RAM R/W operations. In the TLB design, we propose a STT-RAM-based dynamically-configurable TLB (STD-TLB) by leveraging differential sensing technique. The paper “STD-TLB: A STT-RAM-based Dynamically-configurable Translation Lookaside Buffer for GPU” was presented at 19th ASPDAC in Jan 2014, and the paper “STT-RAM based Register File in GPU Architectures” is presented in ASPDAC 2015. Development of a memristor-based neuromophic computing accelerator • Neuromophic accelerator is one of the most promising solutions to combat the power wall in future multicore system. Traditional implementation of neural computing unit is transistor based with separated computing/storage in different type of circuit, which introduces extra power consumption and precision losing in analog/digital converting. I am working on design of a novel reconfigurable memristor-based neuromophic accelerator which can eliminate frequent AD/DA converting with more effective area/energy consumption and support variant applications. The paper “A Heterogeneous Computing System with Memristor-Based Neuromorphic Accelerators” is presented in HPEC 2014 and the paper “Reno: A Highly-efficient Reconfigurable Neuromorphic Computing Accelerator Design” is going to appeal in DAC 2015. Show less

DaVinci Haptic Simulator for Mitral Valve Replacement

projects.name: Augmented Reality Surgical Microscope
projects.description: An Augmented Reality/Virtual Reality, stereoscopic microscope, able to overlap to the optical flow a secondary one, generated by a micro display, adding stereoscopic digital content to the real one. The digital content is synchronized and registered to the real one tracking position and zoom of the microscope. My work has been focused on the software side and part of the basic idea development.

projects.name: Event Driven Surgical Gesture Segmentation and Task Recognition
projects.description: An innovative approach to the automatic recognition of the surgical gestures during surgical procedures. This new approach may enhance surgical training by evaluating surgical instrument movements during a scenario and providing context-relevant feedback.

projects.name: Eye Trauma Simulation
projects.description: This simulation platform is being developed for training eye and facial trauma treatment and offers very innovative features that can improve the trainee learning curve. The project is being developed in the Simulation Group at the Massachusetts General Hospital/Harvard Medical School. My contribution has been to the development of the data analysis algorithms and the majority of the implementation of the simulation and analysis software.

projects.name: e-Check Telemedicine Platform
projects.description: Computer platform installed in some Italian pharmacies that allows patients to perform certain important clinical tests directly in the pharmacy rather than in the clinic, saving time and money and saving all of the exam results in an online profile. My contribution was the system architecture development, supervising a staff of developers and developing the client side application, which integrates multiple medical devices.

projects.name: DaVinci Haptic Simulator for Mitral Valve Replacement
projects.description: Developed as an application of the Meta-balls approach for soft tissue simulation. The simulation platform can easily be applied to create commercial simulation platforms and represents an important instrument to improve the surgeon’s skills while reducing learning time on the real robot, which is more expensive and delicate. The simulator was developed independently at the Harvard Bio-robotics Lab.

projects.name: Stent Implant Simulation Platform
projects.description: Developed as independent project allowing users to learn how to perform a catheter-based stent implant procedure. Use of low-cost computational platforms was emphasized in this effort. I lead the development team and created architecture and software components.

projects.name: Underwater Robot Simulation
projects.description: A virtual reality platform that allows users (and the electronic controller) to learn how to drive an underwater robot, using a vision system and multiple virtual sensors. I created the simulation in support of development of the robotic hardware and controls.

projects.name: Meta-balls approach to Soft Tissue Simulation
projects.description: Application of the “Meta-balls” approach to soft tissue simulation is an alternative to the classic Finite Element Model and has several important advantages that make this model one of the best candidates for surgery simulation and planning. (Ph.D. Thesis).

projects.name: Hyper Viewer
projects.description: Software for rendering 3D content in real time using MATLAB. The software is very useful because it enables very accurate rendering and splits the computational load. It is useful for body movement analysis projects.

projects.name: ADManager, Telemedicine Platform for Specialist Second Opinion
projects.description: Telemedicine platform developed for the Venice area, in order to facilitate the interaction between bed ridden patients and medical specialists. The contribution in this project was the system architecture design and the development of a client-side software application integrating multiple medical devices.

projects.name: Virtual Reality Haptic Laparoscopy Simulator
projects.description: One of the first VR simulation platforms able to provide haptic feedback combined with a realistic graphic rendering.

projects.name: Pic Finder
projects.description: Computer vision application for tablet/palmtop computers able to recognize paintings (inside a museum) and to link to the corresponding content page. I wrote the software for Ducati Sistemi as part of a bigger project for site and museum explorations.

projects.name: Rat Tracking
projects.description: I wrote computer vision software, developed for SISSA (International School for Advanced Studies), to track rats swimming inside a pool for a neuroscience medical project.

projects.name: VREngine
projects.description: A virtual reality engine framework that can be used to develop a wide range of simulations and applications especially for the medical imaging field. This is an area and research topic of personal interest, and I continually update the software engine with the latest hardware capabilities. I have used it to develop many VR projects, including elements of the Eye Trauma Simulation (academic version VRLite) and : Hyper Viewer, Virtual Reality Haptic Laparoscopy Simulator, Meta-balls approach to Soft Tissue Simulation, Underwater Robot Simulation, Stent Implant Simulation Platform, DaVinci Haptic Simulator and minor projects. Show less

projects.name: Finger Tracker
projects.description: I developed computer vision software for SISSA (International School for Advanced Studies), to track the fingers movements of patients inside the MRI scanner for a neuroscience medical project.

projects.name: DG5 VHand - data glove
projects.description: Design, development Hardware/Software, production and business development, to sell the data glove DG5 VHand on the worldwide market.

projects.name: UniBot Mobile Robot
projects.description: Unibot is a prototype of a differential wheeled mobile robot. It was born with the aim to develop an experimental robot platform with a low economic impact for testing and validating the distributed control algorithm that involved groups of robot. The aim also includes the subsequently possibility to implement these algorithms on higher scale robotic platforms. The basic idea of Unibot is to have a robot as much modular as possible, expandable and easy to use, following the idea previously developed at Ecole Polytechnique Federale de Lausanne (EPFL) with the mobile robot E-puck. The basic version is equipped with a very small set of sensors but in any case useful enough to give good performances. Show less

Prior to co-founding DataOrb, I was the SVP of Technology, Innovation & AI Products at Episode Solutions, where I contributed to the organizational and business strategy, built a team of 20+ FTEs, and led the product development of a digital health platform for comprehensive surgical care management, claims processing, physician engagement, and decision support tools for value-based care. I hold multiple master's degrees in Systems Science and Automation, Analytics, Data Science, and Big Data.

publications.title: Review of multidimensional data processing approaches for Raman and infrared spectroscopy
publications.description: Raman and Infrared (IR) spectroscopies provide information about the structure, functional groups and environment of the molecules in the sample. In combination with a microscope, these techniques can also be used to study molecular distributions in heterogeneous samples. Over the past few decades Raman and IR microspectroscopy based techniques have been extensively used to understand fundamental biology and responses of living systems under diverse physiological and pathological conditions. The spectra from biological systems are complex and diverse, owing to their heterogeneous nature consisting of bio-molecules such as proteins, lipids, nucleic acids, carbohydrates etc. Sometimes minor differences may contain critical information. Therefore, interpretation of the results obtained from Raman and IR spectroscopy is difficult and to overcome these intricacies and for deeper insight we need to employ various data mining methods. These methods must be suitable for handling large multidimensional data sets and for exploring the complete spectral information simultaneously. The effective implementation of these multivariate data analysis methods requires the pretreatment of data. The preprocessing of raw data helps in the elimination of noise (unwanted signals) and the enhancement of discriminating features. This review provides an outline of the state-of-the-art data processing tools for multivariate analysis and the various preprocessing methods that are widely used in Raman and IR spectroscopy including imaging for better qualitative and quantitative analysis of biological samples. Show less

publications.title: Rethinking Neural Networks with Benford's Law
publications.description: Benford’s Law (BL) or the Significant Digit Law defines the probability distribution of the first digit of numerical values in a data sample. This Law is observed in many datasets. It can be seen as a measure of naturalness of a given distribution and finds its application in areas like anomaly and fraud detection. In this work, we address the following question: Is the distribution of the Neural Network parameters related to the network’s generalization capability? To that end, we first define a metric, MLH (Model Enthalpy), that measures the closeness of a set of numbers to BL. Second, we use MLH as an alternative to Validation Accuracy for Early Stopping and provide experimental evidence that even if the optimal size of the validation set is known beforehand, the peak test accuracy attained is lower than early stopping with MLH i.e. not using a validation set at all. Show less

publications.title: Introducing Self-Attention to Target Attentive Graph Neural Networks
publications.description: (current SOTA) Session-based recommendation systems suggest relevant items to users by modeling user behavior and preferences using short-term anonymous sessions. Existing methods leverage Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) that propagate and aggregate information from neighboring nodes i.e., local message passing. Such graph-based architectures have representational limits, as a single sub-graph is susceptible to overfit the sequential dependencies instead of accounting for complex transitions between items in different sessions. We propose a new technique that leverages a Transformer in combination with a target attentive GNN. This allows richer representations to be learnt, which translates to empirical performance gains in comparison to a vanilla target attentive GNN. Our experimental results and ablation show that our proposed method is competitive with the existing methods on real-world benchmark datasets, improving on graph-based hypotheses. Code is available at https://github.com/The-Learning-Machines/SBR. Show less

publications.title: Deep Learning for Part of Speech (PoS) Tagging: Konkani

publications.description: In this study we have done the aerodynamic study of a sedan vehicle. The simulation of the external aerodynamics of the vehicles is the most challenging and very much important automotive computational fluid dynamics application. With the speedy improvement in digital computers, computational fluid dynamics is used as a practical tool in present day practical research. In this study two different types of simulations were done. First simulation was done on a simple sedan car to find out the coefficient of drag and coefficient of lift then, the second simulation was done on the same simple sedan car model by installing the rear spoiler to find out the coefficient of drag and coefficient of lift. For all this simulation the base model was made in SolidWorks 2015 by considering the dimensions of the Chevrolet Cruze. This study result shows that the coefficient of drag and coefficient of lift of the vehicle model with spoiler has a mild reduction. This leads to less fuel consumption on the road, helps to maintain traction and increase braking stability. Show less

headline: Co-Founder & CTO at Nebula.io, repeat Co-Founder of AI startups, speaker & advisor on Gen AI and LLM Engineering
summary: I’m a technology leader and entrepreneur. I'm applying AI to a field where it can make a massive impact: helping people discover their potential and pursue their reason for being. But at my core, I’m a software engineer and a scientist. I learned how to code aged 8 and still spend weekends experimenting with Large Language Models and writing code (rather badly). If you’d like to join us to show me how it’s done.. message me! As a work-hobby, I absolutely love giving talks about Gen AI and LLMs. I'm the author of a best-selling, top-rated Udemy course on LLM Engineering, and I speak at O'Reilly Live Events and ODSC workshops. It brings me great joy to help others unlock the astonishing power of LLMs. I spent most of my career at JPMorgan building software for financial markets. I worked in London, Tokyo and New York. I became an MD running a global organization of 300. Then I left to start my own AI business, untapt, to solve the problem that had plagued me at JPM - why is so hard to hire engineers? At untapt we worked with GQR, one of the world's fastest growing recruitment firms. We collaborated on a patented invention in AI and talent. Our skills were perfectly complementary - AI leaders vs recruitment leaders - so much so, that we decided to join forces. In 2020, untapt was acquired by GQR’s parent company and Nebula was born. I’m now Co-Founder and CTO for Nebula, responsible for software engineering and data science. Our stack is Python/Flask, React, Mongo, ElasticSearch, with Kubernetes on GCP. Our 'secret sauce' is our use of Gen AI and proprietary LLMs. If any of this sounds interesting - we should talk!
location_full: New York, New York, United States
active_experience_description: I’m the co-founder and CTO of Nebula.io. We help recruiters source, understand, engage and manage talent, using Generative AI / proprietary LLMs. Our patented model matches people with roles with greater accuracy and speed than previously imaginable — no keywords required. Our long term goal is to help people discover their potential and pursue their reason for being, motivated by a concept called Ikigai. We help people find roles where they will be most fulfilled and successful; as a result, we will raise the level of human prosperity. It sounds grandiose, but since 77% of people don’t consider themselves inspired or engaged at work, it’s completely within our reach.

publications_topics: On Optimizing Interventions in Shared Autonomy
Intervention Aware Shared Autonomy

publications.title: On Optimizing Interventions in Shared Autonomy
publications.description: Shared autonomy refers to approaches for enabling an autonomous agent to collaborate with a human with the aim of improving human performance. However, besides improving performance, it may often also be beneficial that the agent concurrently accounts for preserving the user's experience or satisfaction of collaboration. In order to address this additional goal, we examine approaches for improving the user experience by constraining the number of interventions by the autonomous agent. We propose two model-free reinforcement learning methods that can account for both hard and soft constraints on the number of interventions. We show that not only does our method outperform the existing baseline, but also eliminates the need to manually tune a black-box hyperparameter for controlling the level of assistance. We also provide an in-depth analysis of intervention scenarios in order to further illuminate system understanding. Show less

patents_topics: System and method for real-time transactional data obfuscation
System and method for conversion of JMS message data into database transactions for application to multiple heterogeneous databases

patents.title: System and method for real-time transactional data obfuscation
patents.description: A system and method for providing transactional data privacy while maintaining data usability, including the use of different obfuscation functions for different data types to securely obfuscate the data, in real-time, while maintaining its statistical characteristics. In accordance with an embodiment, the system comprises an obfuscation process that captures data while it is being received in the form of data changes at a first or source system, selects one or more obfuscation techniques to be used with the data according to the type of data captured, and obfuscates the data, using the selected one or more obfuscation techniques, to create an obfuscated data, for use in generating a trail file containing the obfuscated data, or applying the data changes to a target or second system. Show less

patents.title: System and method for conversion of JMS message data into database transactions for application to multiple heterogeneous databases
patents.description: A system and method for performing real-time conversion of data which is present in the form of messages on JMS-compliant or other messaging systems into database transactions, which can then subsequently be applied to multiple heterogeneous databases or other systems. In accordance with an embodiment, the invention provides a means by which data can be read from messages, and converted to a set of database operations that are then stored as a persistent trail file (for example, as an Oracle GoldenGate trail file). The operations, as recorded in the trail file, can then be routed via a network and applied to target systems as required. In accordance with an embodiment, the data can be read in real-time from the messaging system, and written out as quickly as it can be consumed to the persistent trail files. Show less

patents.description: The generation of an online reputation report for an individual is disclosed. First, an online reputation assessment is performed for an individual. Then, a report is generated. The report includes an individualized recommendation based on the online reputation assessment. The recommendation can be directed to the individual and can also be directed to an entity other than the individual.

patents.title: Reputation report with score
patents.description: An online reputation assessment of an individual is performed. A reputation score is determined based on the performed online reputation assessment. The reputation score is provided as output. In some cases, the reputation score is provided to an entity that is not the individual, for example, based on the receipt of an authorization from the individual to disclose the score to the entity.

patents.title: Industry review benchmarking
patents.description: Review data associated with a plurality of entities is received. Each of the entities is associated with a particular industry and the review data comprises review data obtained from a plurality of review sites. From at least a portion of the received review data, a review benchmark for the industry is determined. The benchmark is provided as output.

patents.title: Stimulating reviews at a point of sale
patents.description: A user is solicited to provide a review for a business, while the user is located on a premise of the business. Review data is received from the user. The review data is transmitted to a reputation platform configured to evaluate the received review data. If the review data indicates a positive review, a review request action is commenced. If the review data indicates a negative review, a remedial action is commenced.

recommendations.recommendation: “Roméo m'a apporté un client pour la création d'une application mobile avec Kotlin Multiplatform. Il a pu effectuer la communication avec le client et gérer le projet en me donnant les informations et les accès nécessaires pour réaliser la mission dans les meilleures conditions, jusqu'à la mise en ligne de celle ci sur l'App Store.”

“Si vous cherchez un homme de main sur qui vous appuyer dans vos projets de développement logiciel, Roméo est l'un des meilleurs choix. Durant toute la période où j'ai été son mentor, il n'a pas cessé de montrer les meilleures aptitudes et traits de personnalité : très autodidacte avec de fortes facultés d'assimilation mais humble et attentif, précis dans son travail et ses résultats mais en même temps ouvert d'esprit, pragmatique et resilient quand il rencontre des difficultés, Roméo sais persévérer contre toute adversité surtout quand il a bien défini son objectif. Dans les projets, assurez vous juste qu'il a compris le contexte, ce qu'il doit faire, les contraintes et les paramètres à prendre en compte et après cela, vous pourrez dormir en paix. En cas de blocage, il essaiera toujours différentes alternatives avant de revenir vers vous en vous soulignant le soucis précis. projects.name: Plateforme e-commerce Koffea (Magasin de café à Marseilles)
projects.description: Amélioration et accélération des performances du site E-Commerce Koffea réalisé avec PrestaShop : 1. Analyse des Performances Actuelles : - Audit complet du site pour identifier les points de lenteur et les goulots d'étranglement. - Analyse des temps de chargement des pages et des requêtes serveur. 2. Optimisation du Code et de la Base de Données : - Nettoyage et optimisation du code source pour une meilleure performance. - Optimisation des requêtes SQL et de la base de données pour réduire les temps de réponse. 3. Amélioration de la Configuration du Serveur : - Configuration avancée du serveur web pour une meilleure gestion des ressources. - Mise en place de systèmes de mise en cache efficaces - Optimisation des paramètres PHP et MySQL. 4. Optimisation des Images et du Contenu Statique : - Compression et optimisation des images sans perte de qualité. - Mise en place de la mise en cache des ressources statiques (CSS, JS, images). 6. Test et Monitoring Continu : - Tests de performance après chaque optimisation pour mesurer les améliorations. - Mise en place d'outils de monitoring pour surveiller en continu les performances du site. 7- Migration du site vers un VPS Lien vers le site : https://koffea.fr/ Show less

projects.name: My Golden Bank
projects.description: En collaboration avec My Golden Bank, j'ai eu le privilège de contribuer en tant que prestataire et gestionnaire de projet à une initiative novatrice dans le domaine des services bancaires. Notre objectif était de fournir à nos clients une expérience fluide et pratique grâce aux comptes e-wallet. Nous avons conçu une plateforme sous WordPress offrant une gamme variée de fonctionnalités de rechargement et d'encaissement, permettant aux utilisateurs d'effectuer des transactions financières de manière flexible et sécurisée, le tout regroupé au sein d'un seul compte. Notre approche axée sur le client nous a conduit à personnaliser les services en fonction des besoins spécifiques de chaque utilisateur, mettant ainsi leur satisfaction au cœur de nos priorités. Que ce soit pour des particuliers ou des professionnels, notre équipe est dédiée à répondre à leurs besoins en matière de services financiers électroniques. https://mygoldenbank.fr/ Show less

projects.name: Direction Artistique (Maquette - Logo - Charte graphique - Carte de visite) à ReadyToFly
projects.description: En tant que prestataire chez ReadyToFly, nous avons eu le privilège de prendre en charge une tâche passionnante de Direction Artistique. Notre rôle consistait à créer des maquettes visuelles, concevoir des logos uniques, élaborer des chartes graphiques cohérentes et concevoir des cartes de visite percutantes. Grâce à une collaboration étroite avec l'équipe et une compréhension approfondie des besoins du client, nous avons pu donner vie à des concepts créatifs qui ont véritablement captivé l'attention et renforcé l'identité visuelle de nos clients. Ce fut une expérience enrichissante qui a permis de concrétiser des idées innovantes et de créer des solutions graphiques remarquables. Show less

projects.name: Plateforme d'achat des tickets des jeux olympiques en ligne
projects.description: Ce projet est une application développée avec Django, conçue pour permettre aux utilisateurs d’acheter des tickets en ligne avec un système de paiement sécurisé via Stripe. Fonctionnalités principales - Achat de tickets en ligne - Intégration de paiements sécurisés via Stripe - Gestion des Webhooks Stripe pour le suivi en temps réel des transactions - Interface utilisateur claire et ergonomique - Espace d’administration pour la gestion des offres et événements - Génération automatique de QR codes pour chaque ticket acheté Show less

headline: Co-Founder/CTO at Galileo
summary: Co-founder of Galileo — we help the largest enterprises in the world build Gen AI they
active_experience_description: We founded Galileo to solve the evaluation, observability and data quality problem in unstructured data AI. During our previous chapters leading ML teams at Google, Apple and Uber, the pain of maintaining the quality of models in production was noteworthy. The problem gets 100x harder with unstructured data - language, images and speech. Today, Galileo provides a platform for Gen AI Evaluations and Observability - providing algorithms to detect critical errors in LLM outputs and inputs, via a customizable end to end platform. Set up real-time hallucination guardrails. Galileo is used across Fortune 500 businesses in Finance, Banking, Retail, Healthcare, Internet Services etc. If you're interested in working at the intersection of Machine Learning and data, alongside industry and academic veterans going after a massively underserved problem, we are currently hiring for multiple positions: https://www.rungalileo.io/team#current-openings.

patents.title: Determining a spatial relationship between different user contexts
patents.description: A processing apparatus including one or more processors and memory determines a first context of a first user at a first location in a physical space based on sensor measurements from one or more sensors of a set of one or more devices coupled to the first user and detects movement of the first user to a second location in the physical space based on sensor measurements from one or more sensors of the devices. The processing apparatus determines a second context of the first user at the second location based on sensor measurements from one or more sensors of the devices and generates, based on the first context, the second context, and the movement of the user from the first location to the second location, a first mapping of the physical space that includes information corresponding to a spatial relationship between the first context and the second context.
